text:
Eto SIMPLIFIED Analogy para mga taong disconnected sa realidad.

Kunyare OFW ka sa Taiwan, tapos magkakaron palang ng jollibee dyan, tapos lahat ng tao doon, maki-mcdo.

Kung maki-mcdo sila, di sila required bumili ng chicken joy sa jollibee kung ayaw nila. Tapos ikaw na pinoy nang tagal walang Jollibee, magkakaron ka ng opportunity na makakain. So good yun para sayo.

——

In a weird way, ganon den yung Divorce,  maraming mga pamilya sa bansa natin na nagsusuffer from abuse and a lot more of complicated circumstances. At mas gaganda ang buhay nila kung mapagkakalooban sila opportunidad na to, lalo na kung legalize ng batas.

Kung religion ang issue, seperate the church from the state. Kung sa tingen mong danger yan sa values nyo. Why not teach these people how to be good at themselves first before coming into marriage. Educating these people to prevent yung issue ng separation. At kung magkamali sila at kelanganin nila tong option, wag sana natin ipagkait tong opportunidad na to para umalis sila sa buhay na ayaw nila.

So sana wag  natin i-impose paniniwala natin sa mga taong iba ang pananaw kung di naman natin alam yung dinanas ng kapwa natin. Let’s try to be kinder. Kung ayaw mo ng Divorce, don’t file for it, nilalaban yan sa Korte bago mangyari.

Kaya sana makita natin yung realidad na nararanasan nila. Wag sana natin ipagkait yung magandang buhay para sa mga pamilyang nangangailangan ng Second chance at Life.

Di nyo buhay yun. Sakanila yun. Lets have some empathy my good people. Para sa kapwa natin na nagsusuffer.

Oo may chance na mas maging magulo lalo na sa child custody dahil sa divorce, pero yung realidad ngayon, may mga taong napagkaitan neto na tinitiis yung napakahirap na buhay. Dahil lang pinagkakaitan sila ng kapwa nila ng chance ng bagong buhay. Makiramdam naman kayo.
#YesToDivorce

Palagi ko nababasa yung "I believe in the sanctity of marriage." I agree. However, the sanctity of marriage is not broken by divorce, but by the sins of cheating, abuse, lying, adultery, and other unholy acts. Divorce does not destroy marriage—kasi wasak na naman ang marriage to begin with. Divorce is also not a cure, kasi it marks the end of it. Instead, divorce is an ultimatum, a last resort when every effort to save the marriage fails. 

The "sanctity of marriage" should not preserve sin. The love of God does not want to maintain pain and suffering. The Lord is a loving and liberating God. And, when a marriage is built not by love, but by sin, then the people involved should be given a chance to find God—or love, since God is love—in any other way, rather than preserving the sinful marriage that further destroys faith.
